author: @mdashrafuddin2825
text: These are steps for a Windows 10 Home: 1. Download sublime text https://www.sublimetext.com/3 (it usually shows which one you need by black dot) 2. Download node.js at https://nodejs.org/en/ (Recommended for most users) 3. go to Tools > Build System > New Build System 4. save as Javascript in the ‚ÄúUser‚Äù directory inside Sublime Text settings folder  { "cmd": ["C:/Program Files/nodejs/node.exe", "$file"], "selector": "source.js" }5.to check it, follow the last paragraph of this article from Time for fun part. Create and save..... GOOD LUCK!

author: @maujor1
text: Windows users must use:  {   "shell_cmd": "node ${file}",   "selector" : "source.js" }

author: @confused6526
text: I got the same issue of setting  the "node.sublime-build" file. Here is the directory where you need to put the file in: C:\Users\<your Name>\AppData\Roaming\Sublime Text 3\Packages\User Good luck. J.N

author: @freefromthedome
text: For Windows users,in the new build system type the following: "cmd": ["C:/Program Files/nodejs/node.exe", "$file"],  "selector": "source.js"  To find address of the node,use the command "where node" instead of "which node".
